objectId.description: The unique identifier for the product. Product objectIds are unique across the entire OmniChat platform; no two products will have the same objectIds, even if they are from different shops

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the product was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format UTC time. Example: 2017-08-04T16:27:55.397Z

definition1.description: The name of the first definition for the product. Example: Color

definition1Values.description: The possible values of the first definition for the product. Example: Blue, Green, Black

definition2.description: The name of the second definition for the product. Example: Size

definition2Values.description: The possible values of the second definition for the product. Example: P, M, G

erpId.description: The ERP's code related to the product

blocked.description: Indicated wheater the product is blocked for sale. Blocked products will be listed in the products tab however they cannot be added to orders

service.description: If true the product represents a service

trackInventory.description: If true the OmniChat will track inventory. When a new order is created the product quantity will be decremented. If an order gets cancelled the quantity will be restored

sellOutOfStock.description: Whether the product can be added to an order when the quantity is equal or less than zero

variants.description: The product's variants. Including the mainVariant
